Historical

Biography

Honors and Awards

OVC Academic Medal of Honor: 2017-18

OVC Commissioner's Honor Roll: 2017-18, 2018-19

Dean's List: F16, S17, F17, S18, S19

Athletics Director's Honor Roll: F18

Career Recap: Austin Peay

As a senior in 2019

Made 16 relief appearances, posting a 4.66 ERA in 9.2 innings pitched.

Allowed just one run over his last 10 appearances totaling 7.0 innings (1.29 ERA).

Tossed a scoreless inning of relief against UT Martin to open OVC Tournament, May 22.

Made 2019 debut in Game 2 of the Kentucky series and saw a runner cut down at home during base hit to only batter he faced.

As a junior transfer in 2018

Made 23 relief appearances in his first season and recorded a save.

Did not allow an earned run in nine consecutive relief appearances, April 13-May 13, compiling seven innings during the streak.

Capped streak with 1.2 scoreless innings of relief at nationally-ranked Clemson, May 13, helping to keep the game tied and extend the game into extra innings.

Only run allowed during his streak was an unearned run at Middle Tennessee, April 24, which led to him being tagged for a loss in his only decision of the year.

Called on to record final out in his first APSU outing in Govs season-opener against South Dakota State, Feb. 16, inducing a foul out to record save.

Career Recap prior to Austin Peay

As a sophomore in 2016 at Kansas City Kansas CC

Appeared in 14 games, totaling 11.1 innings pitched for head coach

Pieced together four scoreless outings, Feb. 20-March 5, allowing just one hit over four innings.

Received NJCAA’s Exemplary Academic Award.

As a freshman in 2015 at Park U. (Missouri)

Saw action in 14 outings for head coach Cary Lundy, posting a 2-2 record with a save over 22.2 innings pitched.

Notched wins in back-to-back outings against Missouri Baptist, March 28, and Wiley (Texas), March 31.

Threw six innings in relief at William Woods (Missouri), April 20, allowing one run and striking out four batters.

Named to American Midwest Conference Spring Academic All-Conference team.

Career Recap: Midlands Baseball Academy (Kansas)

Played two seasons of prep career at Midlands as a first baseman, outfielder and pitcher.

Batted .327 during spring of senior season with 15 RBI and had 15 walks to post .519 on-base percentage.

Made eight pitching appearances in senior season, totaling 10.2 innings.

Was a team captain and received program’s character award in 2013, batting .345 with 14 RBI during spring season. Made two relief pitching appearances.

Personal

Alton Ross Walker is the son of Jamie and Natalie Walker.

Father is Jamie "Cat" Walker, an Austin Peay baseball alumnus and member of the APSU Athletics Hall of Fame, who played 10 seasons in the major leagues (Kansas City 1997-98, Detroit 2002-06 and Baltimore 2007-09).

Born Feb. 16.

Has four younger siblings: Harlee, Hannah, James and Isaac.
